name: Flux Capacitor
description: A device that enables time travel when installed in a time machine vehicle.

content.title: Overview
content.body: The **Flux Capacitor** is a fictional device from the 'Back to the Future' series. It is the core component that makes time travel possible when installed in a vehicle.

content.title: Appearance
content.body: The Flux Capacitor is depicted as a Y-shaped device with three flashing lights, often housed in a clear container. It emits a soft glow and is mounted behind the driver's seat of the DeLorean time machine.

content.title: Function
content.body: When the vehicle's speed reaches precisely 88 miles per hour, the flux capacitor is activated, allowing the vehicle to travel through time to a specified date. It operates using 1.21 gigawatts of electricity.

content.title: History
content.body: The Flux Capacitor was created by **Dr. Emmett Brown** after he envisioned the design following a head injury. This pivotal moment led to his lifelong pursuit of creating a working time machine.

content.title: Story Significance
content.body: The Flux Capacitor is crucial to the plot of 'Back to the Future,' enabling **Marty McFly** to travel through time to various key moments. Its failure and repair are central to multiple plot points in the series.
